intro: Willughbeia novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea willow, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of New Guinea. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often climbing stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, which bloom during the wet season. Willughbeia novoguineensis thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
